meanings.definition: To remove or lessen the strength or resolve of (someone)
meanings.sent1: The harsh criticism was unsteeling her confidence.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather unsteels the metal over time.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's adorable antics unsteel even the toughest of hearts.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected betrayal unsteels his trust in others.
meanings.sent5: The constant failures unsteel his determination to succeed.

meanings.definition: To make less strong or firm
meanings.sent1: The heat of the sun unsteel the frozen ground.
meanings.sent2: The weight of the books unsteels the shelf over time.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick unsteels the audience's belief in reality.
meanings.sent4: The wind unsteels the resolve of the fragile tree branches.
meanings.sent5: The continuous pressure unsteels the metal rod.

meanings.sent1: The detergent unsteels the tough stains on the fabric.
meanings.sent2: The warm water unsteels the frozen vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes unsteel the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent4: The gentle music unsteels the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The kind words unsteel her hardened heart.
